ent.origin: Early 17th century: from Italian ombrella, diminutive of ombra 'shade', from Latin umbra

p.def: A device consisting of a circular canopy of cloth on a folding metal frame supported by a central rod, used as protection against rain.
p.eg: She decided to open the umbrella once Soo Lin turned to face her, so the umbrella would expand in her face.

ent.rhy: Della, dispeller, dweller, Ella, expeller, favela, fella, fellah, feller, Fenella, Floella, foreteller, Heller, impeller, interstellar, Keller, Louella, Mandela, mortadella, mozzarella, Nigella, novella, paella, panatella, patella, predella, propeller.
